main event: Civilian observers saw a round, flaming object fall from the sky near Gander, Newfoundland, on 25-26 February 1958.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 5 feet in diameter and left a visible vapor trail., No tracks, metal, or sound were found at the landing site., A clearing was discovered indicating something had touched down, with snow disturbed in a perfect triangular shape., One witness reported seeing a long, red streak in the sky, which might have been a snowplow at work., The sighting was evaluated as a fabrication for publicity purposes and did not warrant further investigation.
